channel.title: The Hodljuice Daily Pint
channel.itunes:author: curated by Hodljuice
channel.description: Daily collection of various Bitcoin-related podcasts

item.title: 21 in 21: 21 in 21: Nick Slaney
item.itunes:author: 21 in 21
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin integration, Lightning payments, Future of Bitcoin, Developer tools
item.description: In this episode, Nick Slaney, the founder of Money Dev Kit, discusses his work at Presidio Bitcoin Design Week with host Haley Berkoe. He shares insights on his preference for Bitcoin over stablecoins, emphasizing the role of Lightning service providers in improving usability. Slaney also expresses an optimistic vision for Bitcoin's future, rooted in developer-friendly tools and solutions.

item.title: BTC Sessions: School Kills Curiosity: Bitcoiners Proven Fix | Kerry McDonald
item.itunes:author: BTC Sessions
item.itunes:keywords: Education reform, Unschooling, Bitcoin philosophy, Parental choice
item.description: Kerry McDonald explores alternative education methods such as unschooling, homeschooling, and micro-schooling in this episode of BTC Sessions. He emphasizes the need for self-directed education aligned with Bitcoin's decentralized philosophy. The episode discusses the dangers of learned helplessness in traditional education and advocates for parental involvement in educational choices to raise resilient children prepared for a Bitcoin future.

item.title: Bitcoin Archive w Archie: “This Is How The 1% Will Survive In Bitcoin” — Prof. Few JUST Destroyed 3 MAJOR MYTHS
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Archive w Archie
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin myths, Wealth survival, Cryptocurrency dynamics
item.description: Professor Few challenges three prevalent Bitcoin myths in this provocative episode, shedding light on how the wealthiest individuals navigate the Bitcoin landscape. He calls for critical examination of commonly held beliefs around Bitcoin, encouraging listeners to reconsider the narratives surrounding cryptocurrency's value and survival.

item.title: Bitcoin Audible: Read 908 - The Utility of Bitcoin
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Audible
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin as a utility, Value transfer, Economic impact
item.description: This episode shares Roy Sheinfeld’s perspective on Bitcoin evolving beyond an asset into a network facilitating value transfer. The discussion emphasizes the potential for Bitcoin to dissolve geographical borders and catalyze a new creator economy utilizing the Lightning Network, all while fundamentally altering how we perceive money in society.

item.title: Bitcoin News Alerts Daily BTC News: 2142: CZ: “Bitcoin Will Flip Gold” – SpaceX Moves $257M in BTC
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin News Alerts Daily BTC News
item.itunes:keywords: Market predictions, Institutional investment, Cryptocurrency trends
item.description: In this episode, Binance CEO CZ predicts that Bitcoin will surpass gold in value, while SpaceX's significant Bitcoin transactions signal growing institutional involvement in cryptocurrency. The discussion also covers the implications of market corrections, political influences, and the behavior of wealthy entities amidst uncertainty, suggesting that fear often drives buying among billionaires.

item.title: Coin Stories: David Marcus: How Bitcoin Becomes the Internet of Money (and Beats Gold)
item.itunes:author: Coin Stories
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin as digital currency, Future of payments, Innovation in finance
item.description: Natalie Brunell engages David Marcus in a discussion about Bitcoin's potential to become the "Internet of Money" and its trajectory toward outpacing gold in value. The conversation delves into stablecoins, Bitcoin's role in digital commerce, and the innovative services being developed by Lightspark to enhance Bitcoin transactions, highlighting the importance of modern digital assets in our financial landscape.

item.title: Money Matters with Jack Mallers: The End of Fiat: Bitcoin’s Time Has Come
item.itunes:author: Money Matters with Jack Mallers
item.itunes:keywords: Currency transition, Bitcoin adoption, Economic policies
item.description: Jack Mallers addresses the shift away from fiat currencies and Bitcoin's rising relevance in the financial landscape of the episode. He discusses the potential consequences of current economic policies and how Bitcoin can address inflationary pressures. The episode encourages listeners to reconsider the implications of relying on fiat and highlights real-world examples of Bitcoin's adoption as a financial alternative.

item.title: Onramp Bitcoin Media: Citi, Schwab, Nubank, & Aureo: The Global Bitcoin Race for 21 Million
item.itunes:author: Onramp Bitcoin Media
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin exchanges, Stablecoins, Institutional developments
item.description: This episode discusses advancements in the global Bitcoin ecosystem, including the emergence of retail Bitcoin and Ethereum exchange-traded products in the UK and stablecoin developments in Japan and Latin America. It outlines the competitive landscape among financial institutions like Citi and Schwab, exploring their plans for custody solutions and the implications for Bitcoin's future valuation amidst regional market dynamics.

item.title: PlebUnderGround: 6.8 Billion Dollar Bitcoin Fraud, KYC Fail, Almost Hacked, The Government Loves Bitcoin!
item.itunes:author: PlebUnderGround
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin fraud, Compliance issues, Market analysis
item.description: In this episode, the hosts analyze a significant $6.8 billion fraud incident in the Bitcoin space and discuss the impact of government initiatives on cryptocurrency pricing. They also address a notable KYC failure and provide insights into major companies' movements in the Bitcoin market while exploring what these developments mean for the broader landscape of crypto.

item.title: Robin Seyr: 50 Ounces of Gold per 1 Bitcoin Within 12 Months (Here’s the Math)
item.itunes:author: Robin Seyr
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin valuation, Gold comparison, Financial sovereignty
item.description: In this episode, Robin Seyr discusses the interplay between Bitcoin, gold, and energy grids with Source Node. They argue that measuring Bitcoin against gold provides a clearer context than fiat, emphasizing the intrinsic value of gold and Bitcoin's role in promoting individual sovereignty. The conversation also touches on historical insights and future potential for Bitcoin mining energy trends.

item.title: Simply Bitcoin: Are Gold & Silver Being Manipulated?! Will Bitcoin Have its "Wallstreet Bets" Moment? | Bitcoin Simply
item.itunes:author: Simply Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Market manipulation, Financial crisis, Bitcoin predictions
item.description: Dante Cook discusses the surging prices of gold and silver in light of the financial system's instability and predicts Bitcoin's potential "Wall Street Bets" moment. The episode emphasizes that as traditional fiat systems contract, Bitcoin stands out as the remaining real asset amidst growing manipulation in gold and silver markets.

item.title: Simply Bitcoin: GOLD Marketcap Loses 5%: Is It FINALLY Bitcoin's Turn To EXPLODE?! | EP 1358
item.itunes:author: Simply Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Market trends, Bitcoin potential, Investment shifts
item.description: The episode addresses the gold market's recent correction and speculates whether this will pave the way for Bitcoin's rise. As market conditions change, the hosts discuss what this means for Bitcoin's future prospects and potential for investors.

item.title: Simply Bitcoin: BREAKING: World’s 4th-Largest Economy Going ALL-IN on Bitcoin?! | EP 1357
item.itunes:author: Simply Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Economic transitions, Bitcoin adoption, Global markets
item.description: This episode covers the shift towards Bitcoin adoption by one of the world's largest economies. The hosts analyze the implications of this transition, discussing how such official endorsements might impact the broader market climate and interest in Bitcoin.

item.title: Simply Bitcoin: Why Everyone’s Chasing Gold Instead of Bitcoin Right Now | Simply SatoSHE
item.itunes:author: Simply Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Investment behavior, Market psychology, Bitcoin dynamics
item.description: The episode critiques current trends where investors are favoring gold despite its notable price surges. The host argues that beneath the surface, significant acquisition of Bitcoin is happening among institutions and governments, which sets the stage for an unprecedented transition in financial assets as scarcity drives value.

item.title: Simply Bitcoin: Did Gold Just Signal a 557% Bitcoin Eruption?! | Simply Originals
item.itunes:author: Simply Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Price signals, Bitcoin forecasts, Financial predictions
item.description: The episode discusses a significant signal from the gold market that may indicate a substantial price increase for Bitcoin. The hosts analyze the current economic landscape to predict Bitcoin's potential for explosive growth amidst ongoing tensions in fiat and equity markets.

item.title: Simply Bitcoin: Print or Collapse? | Why Bitcoin Is About to EXPLODE! | Bitcoin Simply
item.itunes:author: Simply Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Economic policy, Bitcoin opportunity, Crisis response
item.description: Host Dante Cook analyzes the precarious state of the financial system, suggesting that liquidity challenges may force the Fed into more extensive quantitative easing measures. The episode posits these conditions could trigger a historic rise in Bitcoin's value, underscoring the urgency for investors to consider Bitcoin.

item.title: Supply Shock: Bitcoin's Crisis of Stagnation, Upgrades, & Control | Paul Sztorc
item.itunes:author: Supply Shock
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin governance, Development challenges, Lightning Network
item.description: Paul Sztorc joins the episode to explore the politics and development challenges surrounding Bitcoin, particularly focusing on the Lightning Network and user-developer dynamics. The discussion delves into the implications of transaction incentives, governance power struggles, and the influences on Bitcoin's long-term sustainability, offering a thorough overview of current development battles.

item.title: TFTC A Bitcoin Podcast: From Residential Solar to Bitcoin Mining | Kent Halliburton, Center of Hash E010
item.itunes:author: TFTC A Bitcoin Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin mining, Renewable energy, Economic incentives
item.description: Kent Halliburton shares his journey from residential solar to Bitcoin mining in this episode of TFTC. He discusses the efficiencies of hydro-powered mining sites and the need for decentralized mining operations to break away from traditional financial models. The episode highlights the significance of aligning economic incentives in the Bitcoin mining industry amidst evolving challenges.

item.title: The Bitcoin Matrix: Bram Kanstein - The Biggest Technological Battle Ever
item.itunes:author: The Bitcoin Matrix
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin evolution, Technological adoption, Cypherpunk movement
item.description: In this insightful conversation with Bram Kanstein, the hosts dissect the evolving landscape of Bitcoin amidst technological clashes. They discuss the historical roots of the cypherpunk movement, current trends towards mainstream adoption, and the potential impacts of upcoming regulations like the digital euro on Bitcoin's future.

item.title: The Bitcoin Standard Podcast: 296. The Fiat Standard Lecture 15: Bitcoin Banking
item.itunes:author: The Bitcoin Standard Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Banking structure, Bitcoin savings, Financial risk
item.description: This lecture focuses on the demand for secure deposits and storage under a Bitcoin standard, highlighting the benefits of Bitcoin’s self-custody. The discussion reviews how traditional banking systems are affected by Bitcoin's emergence, addressing the risks and efficiencies in capital allocation when adhering to a Bitcoin standard.

item.title: The Block Reward Bitcoin For Beginners: 103: Michael Dunworth ON: The Treasury Game That’s Crashing Bitcoin Stocks
item.itunes:author: The Block Reward Bitcoin For Beginners
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin investment risks, Market dynamics, Custody issues
item.description: Michael Dunworth discusses the complex illusions surrounding Bitcoin treasury companies and the inherent risks they bring to investors. The episode examines how the misunderstanding of custodianship impacts perceived Bitcoin value and market dynamics, urging listeners to remain vigilant about the realities faced by Bitcoin investors today.

item.title: The Canadian Bitcoiners Podcast: Conference Wrap Up, Signal and AWS, Capital Gains Laws for Bitcoin | The CBP 237 Pt 1
item.itunes:author: The Canadian Bitcoiners Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin conferences, Economic implications, Community building
item.description: The hosts recap the significant points from the Canadian Bitcoin Conference, highlighting Bitcoin's potential impact on the Canadian economy and discussions surrounding capital gains laws. They stress the importance of community and technological advancements like AWS in enhancing Bitcoin infrastructure and future opportunities for innovation within Canada.

item.title: The Mining Pod: NABs Takeaways: What Ppl Miss About the BTC ETF, Alberta Is Just Getting Started With BTC
item.itunes:author: The Mining Pod
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin ETFs, Institutional adoption, Mining dynamics
item.description: This episode features insights from the North American Blockchain Summit, where interviews reveal the evolving institutional landscape of Bitcoin and the importance of Alberta in Bitcoin mining. Discussions cover the dynamics of Bitcoin ETFs, the implications of regulatory changes, and Alberta's commitment to reducing red tape for miners, signaling a bright future for Bitcoin infrastructure.

item.title: The Pomp Podcast: Why Bitcoin Will Beat Gold In The Long Run | Anthony & John Pompliano
item.itunes:author: The Pomp Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Market analysis, Asset comparison, Economic outlook
item.description: Anthony and John Pompliano analyze various market trends, contrasting Bitcoin's potential to surpass gold against the backdrop of current economic shifts. They discuss the dynamics of risk versus safe-havens and provide insights into the behaviors of retail investors compared to institutions, exploring broader impacts like government shutdowns and Federal Reserve policies.

item.title: Bitcoin News Alerts Daily BTC News: 2141: Billionaire Predicts $1.5M Bitcoin Supercycle – Saylor Doubles Down on BTC
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin News Alerts Daily BTC News
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin Supercycle, Institutional Adoption, Market Analysis
item.description: A prominent billionaire predicts that Bitcoin will enter a $1,500,000 supercycle, emphasizing its potential to surpass gold as the leading global asset. Michael Saylor amplifies his commitment by increasing his Bitcoin holdings toward 700,000 BTC, coinciding with institutional interest surging. As Bitcoin reaches $111K, analysts see a 70% breakout pattern forming, which could set the stage for a record rally by year-end. The podcast also touches on various news stories, including Bolivia's support for blockchain and market pressures on crypto funds.

item.title: Bitcoin for Millennials: Japan's Financial Collapse Will Trigger a HUGE Bitcoin Bull Run | Roberto Rios | BFM198
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin for Millennials
item.itunes:keywords: Global Monetary System, Bitcoin's Role, Economic Analysis
item.description: Macro analyst Roberto Rios discusses the impending risks of Japan’s bond crisis and its broader impact on the global financial landscape. The episode analyzes how the breakdown of traditional fiat systems can propel Bitcoin as a neutral reserve asset. Key points include the unsustainable nature of debt in advanced economies and the potential global ramifications, particularly for the dollar system. Rios highlights how Bitcoin may serve as a crucial lifeboat for economic stability amid these challenges.

item.title: Coin Stories: News Block: Bitcoin Price Rebounding, Odds for Next "Big Print" Rise, DOJ Seizes 127K Bitcoin from Pig-Butchering Scheme
item.itunes:author: Coin Stories
item.itunes:keywords: Market Trends, Bitcoin Seizures, Economic Insights
item.description: This week's Coin Stories News Block discusses Bitcoin's rebound following a significant deleveraging event and the likelihood of new rounds of money printing due to liquidity pressures. Additionally, the episode highlights the U.S. government's recent seizure of 127,000 Bitcoin linked to an international scam, as well as insights from notable figures on market volatility. The podcast aims to inform listeners about crucial events in the macroeconomic landscape without offering direct investment advice.

item.title: Robin Seyer: You’ll Never See Money The Same After Bitcoin
item.itunes:author: Robin Seyer
item.itunes:keywords: Economic Psychology, Media Influence, Bitcoin's Future
item.description: Nolan Bauerle delves into how the concept of Bitcoin is transforming perceptions of money amid the 'fiat apocalypse.' The episode emphasizes the psychological barriers individuals face in understanding economic realities and how media shapes public opinion about Bitcoin. Discussions include the breakdown of historical consensus models and the community's responsibility to address cognitive dissonance among the public. The insights provided aim to deepen understanding of Bitcoin's potential as a decentralized monetary system.

item.title: Simply Bitcoin: $500K Bitcoin Is Coming & The Banks Can’t Stop It | George Bodine
item.itunes:author: Simply Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin Price Predictions, Financial Systems, Wealth Distribution
item.description: George Bodine predicts that Bitcoin will reach $500,000, arguing that traditional financial cycles have been disrupted. The episode discusses the implications of institutional moves by firms like BlackRock and how they can influence Bitcoin's price trajectory. Key discussions target the role of retail investors, challenges faced when adopting Bitcoin, and reflections on how Bitcoin could affect wealth distribution globally amidst financial turmoil.

item.title: Simply Bitcoin: How Bitcoin Exposes the $36 Trillion Debt Problem | Beyond Bitcoin
item.itunes:author: Simply Bitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Global Debt, Financial Sovereignty, Economic Risks
item.description: This episode investigates America's staggering $36 trillion debt and examines the intricate web of global debt that sustains modern economies. The host emphasizes Bitcoin's potential as a financial lifeboat in the face of this debt crisis, challenging listeners to consider how sovereign debt may lead to national economic implosion. The dialogue brings critical awareness to the risks inherent in the current economic system, positioning Bitcoin as a cornerstone of financial freedom.

item.title: Store of Bitcoin Bitcoin as Store of Value: Ep. 40 - Roberto Rios (Peruvian Bull) | Gold shows where Bitcoin is headed
item.itunes:author: Store of Bitcoin Bitcoin as Store of Value
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin vs Gold, Economic Policy, Market Reactions
item.description: Roberto Rios discusses how parallels between Bitcoin and gold set the stage for the future of Bitcoin in financial markets. He analyzes Japan's recent economic policies and their impact on global liquidity. Rios argues that understanding Bitcoin’s utility is vital for recognizing its potential to outperform gold as a global asset, while also addressing skepticism around Bitcoin’s legitimacy as a reserve asset.

item.title: TFTC A Bitcoin Podcast: #673: Following The Puck in Real Estate with Chris Drzyzga
item.itunes:author: TFTC A Bitcoin Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Real Estate, Bitcoin Integration, Economic Strategies
item.description: In this episode, Chris Drzyzga, a commercial real estate professional, shares insights on how Bitcoin can help resolve challenges in the commercial real estate sector by integrating into financial strategies. They discuss how Bitcoin can be utilized for treasury strategies, collateralized loans, and inventory management amid monetary debasement. The conversation focuses on the transformational potential of Bitcoin within the real estate industry.

item.title: Bitcoin Infinity Show: Bitcoin Hardware Wallet Innovation with Stadicus | Bitcoin Infinity Show #173
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Infinity Show
item.itunes:keywords: Hardware Security, Wallet Technology, Bitcoin Innovation
item.description: Stadicus from BitBox discusses the latest advancements in hardware wallet security and the importance of these innovations for the Bitcoin ecosystem. They share insights into creating accessible node software and elaborate on security measures essential for safeguarding Bitcoin investments. This conversation highlights the continual evolution of technology within the cryptocurrency space.

item.title: The Bugle Weekly: Puppets On Strings Shout No Kings | Bugle Weekly Episode 81
item.itunes:author: The Bugle Weekly
item.itunes:keywords: Political Accountability, Citizen Engagement, Governance
item.description: This episode discusses the themes of power dynamics and accountability, employing the metaphor of "puppets on strings" to explore contemporary political issues. The team emphasizes the necessity of active citizen participation in democracy as opposed to passive observation. The conversation concludes with humorous reflections on political theater's absurdities, encouraging listeners to consider their roles in governance.

item.title: The Pomp Podcast: $180K Bitcoin In 2025? Here’s the Case | Chris Klein
item.itunes:author: The Pomp Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Retirement Investing, Bitcoin Potential, Economic Trends
item.description: Chris Klein explores the evolving landscape of retirement investing and the role of Bitcoin within that context, suggesting a potential rise to $180,000 by the end of 2025. Discussions cover how the wealthy utilize retirement accounts for accelerated wealth growth and the implications of macroeconomic factors on personal finance. The episode provides insights into the intersection of finance, technology, and current societal challenges.

item.title: What Bitcoin Did: Bitcoin Is Rebuilding the Financial System | Andrew Hohns
item.itunes:author: What Bitcoin Did
item.itunes:keywords: Financial Trust, Bitcoin in Finance, Credit Markets
item.description: Andrew Hohns discusses the potential of Bitcoin-backed credit to restore trust in the global financial systems suffering from inflation and inefficiencies. The conversation delves into the integration of Bitcoin in institutional finance, its implications for mortgages, and innovative proposals like BitBonds that could revolutionize sovereign debt. The episode emphasizes Bitcoin as an ideal form of collateral for modern credit markets.

item.title: Bitcoin Takeover Podcast: S16 E51: Sean Bowe on Bitcoin, Zcash & Scaling Privacy with Tachyon
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Takeover Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Zcash, Project Tachyon, Bitcoin Privacy, Cryptography
item.description: In this episode, cryptographer Sean Bowe discusses his contributions to Zcash, including fixing an inflation bug and developing Halo, which removes the need for a trusted setup. He introduces Project Tachyon, which aims to scale ZK-SNARKs for mass usage. Key topics include Zcash's messaging capabilities, Bitcoin's privacy limitations, and advancements in cryptocurrency privacy technology. The conversation explores both technical challenges and the future of privacy in the cryptocurrency landscape.

item.title: Onramp Bitcoin Media: From Gold Rush to Bitcoin Standard: Inflation’s Coming for Your Balance Sheet
item.itunes:author: Onramp Bitcoin Media
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin Integration, Inflation, Business Strategy, Counterparty Risk
item.description: In this episode of Bitcoin for Businesses, the hosts discuss how Bitcoin is being integrated into the business landscape, focusing on Square's payment system. They examine the relationship between inflation, gold, and Bitcoin, emphasizing the importance of understanding counterparty risk related to Bitcoin. Multinational banks' engagement with Bitcoin and tax considerations for businesses accepting it are also discussed. This episode provides actionable insights for businesses adapting to Bitcoin integration.

item.title: Onramp Media: From Gold Rush to Bitcoin Standard: Inflation’s Coming for Your Balance Sheet
item.itunes:author: Onramp Media
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin Adoption, Business Financial Practices, Inflation, Multinational Banks
item.description: This episode explores how businesses can adapt to a landscape increasingly influenced by Bitcoin. The hosts discuss Square's integration of Bitcoin payments and analyze the broader implications of inflation on the financial system, including the relationship between gold and Bitcoin. Topics like counterparty risk in Bitcoin holdings and tax considerations for businesses that accept Bitcoin are covered. The episode serves as a strategic guide for operators looking to employ Bitcoin effectively.

item.title: Robin Seyer: You Don’t Own Anything Until You Own Bitcoin
item.itunes:author: Robin Seyer
item.itunes:keywords: Ownership, Self-Custody, Cybersecurity, Cryptocurrency Risks
item.description: Robin Seyer discusses the misconception of ownership in the context of Bitcoin, stressing that true ownership requires self-custody practices. He emphasizes the importance of cybersecurity in managing Bitcoin assets and the risks associated with cryptocurrency investments. The episode encourages listeners to thoroughly research local regulations before investing and highlights available resources for self-custody best practices. Robin reminds audiences that the advice shared is not financial advice.

item.title: SimplyBitcoin: Bitcoin CRASHES Below $104K! Time to SELL?!
item.itunes:author: SimplyBitcoin
item.itunes:keywords: Market Analysis, Bitcoin Volatility, Investment Strategy, Store of Value
item.description: This episode discusses the recent decline in Bitcoin prices dropping below $104K. Amid rising fears among investors regarding market volatility, the hosts argue for holding onto Bitcoin as a prudent strategy instead of selling. The conversation emphasizes maintaining conviction during uncertain times and the potential of Bitcoin to act as a stable investment amidst economic fluctuations. Key insights into effective investment strategies are shared.

item.title: TFTC A Bitcoin Podcast: #672: China’s Rare Earth Dominance and the End of Dollar Hegemony with Luke Gromen
item.itunes:author: TFTC A Bitcoin Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Geopolitics, Dollar Hegemony, Rare Earths, Economics
item.description: In this episode, Marty interviews Luke Gromen about China's leverage over rare earth resources and its implications for U.S. dollar dominance. The discussion highlights the potential shift from Treasury bonds to gold as the primary reserve asset and addresses challenges in reshoring American manufacturing. Luke explains why dollar debasement is a likely outcome due to these geopolitical changes.

item.title: The Bitcoin Way Podcast: THE Bitcoin Mistake You Can’t Make! | Bitcoin Banter
item.itunes:author: The Bitcoin Way Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Self-Custody, Investment Risks, Bitcoin Security, Best Practices
item.description: This episode discusses critical mistakes that could result in losing significant Bitcoin wealth due to hacks. The hosts focus on the importance of self-custody practices and share cautionary tales about the repercussions of neglecting Bitcoin security. They highlight how careful planning and awareness can help secure investments and avoid common pitfalls in managing Bitcoin holdings.

item.itunes:author: The Mark Moss Show
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin Capital Markets, Financial Innovation, Investment Strategies, Leverage
item.description: Dan Hillery joins to discuss the evolution of Bitcoin capital markets and the rise of companies using Bitcoin as collateral for innovative financial products. Topics include the mechanics of debt leverage and shifting investment models in the public markets.

item.title: Swan Signal Live A Bitcoin Show: Bitcoin Crash & Fed Pivot: Why the Thesis Still Holds

item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Audible
item.itunes:keywords: Financial system collapse, Wealth transfer, Central bank digital currencies, Unsecured creditors
item.description: This episode explores the claim that the 1933 Bank Holiday was a planned wealth transfer rather than a rescue, setting the stage for today's financial system's collapse. David Rogers Webb argues that the Federal Reserve's structure allowed selected banks to reopen with government losses covered, making cash depositors unsecured creditors. The discussion highlights alarming derivatives figures that surpass the global economy's value and warns of increasing threats to private deposits as central bank digital currencies emerge. Listeners are prompted to consider whether we're witnessing a final financial heist.

This episode explores the potential political pathways for adopting Bitcoin within Sweden's government and raises awareness about the risks of Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) while championing individual financial sovereignty.
